0X0(1) General Commands Manual 0X0(1)

NAME

0x0 — interface with https://0x0.st

SYNOPSIS

0x0 file file

0x0 url url

0x0 shorten url

DESCRIPTION

The 0x0 utility is an interface to the https://0x0.st file sharing and url shortening service.

The following commands are available.

file file
Upload file. If file is -, input will be read from stdin.
url url
Upload the remote file at url. Supported protocols are http and https.
shorten url
Shorten url, i.e return a short url that redirects to url when opened. Supported protocols are http and https.

EXIT STATUS

The 0x0 utility exits 0 on upload/shortening, and 1 if an error occurs.

EXAMPLES

Upload the source code of 0x0:

$ 0x0 file "$(which 0x0)"
https://0x0.st/iU8B.bin

Upload a diff:

$ diff old new | 0x0 file -
https://0x0.st/iU8L.txt

Upload a remote file:

$ 0x0 url http://www.openbsd.org/art/puffy/ppuf800X725.gif
https://0x0.st/iU8n.gif

Shorten a url:

$ 0x0 shorten https://why-openbsd.rocks
https://0x0.st/PmsW

SEE ALSO

curl(1)

https://0x0.st/
